page.title: 20S/N Local History PlaceNames
page.content: Monson Road, Northorpe is named after a 17C family with Civil War connec- tions (some think Northorpe may have been the scene of fighting in that war);the church has a memorial to William Monson, eldest son of John and Mary Monson, who died in 1638. River Eau, pronounced Ee, looks French but is of Scandianvian derivation.Crapple Lane, Scotton (derivation uncertain, possibly from Crabapple) was already so named in 1682.Scotton Church is most unusually dedicated to St Genewys a name most probably of French origin. Some think it is a corruption of Genevieve.However a 19C memorial window in the church refers to St Genewys, Bishop of Clermont: there was a 7C Bishop Genes of Glermont (in the Auvergne), but how a church in a tiny North Lincolnshire village came to be dedicated to him remains a mystery.
